Dialogue: I expect to see you at my sermon with the others tonight.
What did you say? You're not interested?
How dare you! You've always been the troublemaker of the group.
Go sit in the time out corner and don't leave until the sermon begins.
Are you acting this way because of the news? The world ending?
Ahahahaha, as if that would make any difference to you.
Whether you like it or not, you're stuck here and always will be.
I expect to see you sitting in the corner for the rest of the day.
As long as you live here, you will do as I tell you.
If you disobey me, you won't see the sun for a week!
I won't hesitate to board your windows.
You forgot what I said already?
